alert.note: Alert for Hardeman; Wichita; Wilbarger (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 12:43AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Comanche, northwestern Stephens, Cotton, Tillman, northern Wichita, Wilbarger and southeastern Hardeman Counties through 130 AM CDT... At 1243 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fort Sill to near Faxon to 4 miles southwest of Grandfield to 3 miles northwest of Harrold to 3 miles east of Medicine Mound. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lawton, Vernon, Burkburnett, Walters, Cache, Electra, Geronimo, Grandfield, Chillicothe, Chattanooga, Randlett, Medicine Park, Indiahoma, Davidson, Devol, Faxon, Hollister, Loveland, Lockett and Fargo. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 0 and 50. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
